intro: Trochocephalus hairalensis, commonly known as the Madagascar bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth. It has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its specific epithet "hairalensis." Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest in horticulture and botanical research.
